greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the unique real solution of the equation Ei(x)-gamma-log(x) = 1, where Ei is the exponential integral function and gamma the Euler-Mascheroni constant.
comment: This constant is an auxiliary constant used in computing the asymptotic probability of success in one of the Secretary problems.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 5.15, p. 362.
mathematica: a = x /. FindRoot[ExpIntegralEi[x] - EulerGamma - Log[x] == 1, {x, 1}, WorkingPrecision -> 105]; RealDigits[a, 10, 100] // First
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, May 20 2014
